Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 07:53PM millwrightwife wrote: Poohgrl...could just be if her breasts were very dense, they may want to do a sonogram just to be sure....Or could even be a possibility that maybe she had moved and there may be a shadow on the film.  Keep us updated...and all the best!
Posts.Title: Mammogram additional viewing request poohgrl77 hopeful4ever

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 08:12PM millwrightwife wrote: redjenn....the mole and immediate skin made it to pathology..but the breast tissue and the lump did not....Surgeon says he sent the whole sample....Path Lab says they only received the skin and mole...basically a "shave biopsy".... Remember you are your best advocate.  Not only should you request your reports (they are yours)...but request that it be sent to your PC/GP....and they should not give you any problems about it....hopefully, it is just something that they overlooked...I would call and ask again, just a gentle nudge in their direction....if you had it done at a hospital....I know ours here also keeps records, and you can pick it up at the record keeping dept. there, it is the exact same report.  Also, with the history of fibroadenoma, you have an increased risk....so, being alert and concerned will only be a help for you. Hope that helps.....
Posts.Title: Neverending Nightmare millwrightwife millwrightwife

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2009 01:09AM millwrightwife wrote: Bless your heart Sparrow!  I had an MRI done in 2005.  When I had mine done, I had music they let me listen to....also, I had to wear a hospital gown...but, each facitlity will be different.  Time wise, I believe mine took about 40 minutes...but after 30 minutes they stopped and put the contrast dye in.  It wasn't bad.  Just have to be really still is all...
Posts.Title: I just can't deal with this Sparrow one-L

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2009 11:09PM millwrightwife wrote: Waiting is worse than knowing!  I have been waiting 6 weeks now...so I know EXACTLY what you are going through.  I can handle whatever it is just tell me!!!  LOL  I guess the silver lining here...is if they feel they can wait until Sept 11, then it is not an immediate threat?  I know that is small consolation.  When you get your next path results in...and if your Dr. feels that the date needs to be moved up...don't worry, it will.  So, maybe you can look at it in those terms...and maybe it won't be as worrisome...I hope it helped...have fun at the cottage!!!!   And keep us informed!
Posts.Title: Waiting forever it seems catpyn millwrightwife
